titleInfo.title: Geological map of Cocke County, Tennessee (1839)

mods.abstract: Drawn by Gerard Troost, Tennessee's first State Geologist, this geological map of Cocke County shows early roads, rivers and mineral resources including iron ore and limestone. Other landmarks include the French Broad River and Big Pigeon River, named springs, furnaces and iron works. Some landowners and roads are named, with the main purpose being to indicate the location of potentially commercial mineral deposits.

This map was printed in the Fifth Report (to the Tennessee General Assembly) of Dr. Gerard Troost, State Geologist. Troost, a native of the Netherlands, was Tennessee's first state geologist and first president of the Philadelphia Academy of Natural Sciences. He was a professor of chemistry, geology, and mineralogy at the University of Nashville for 22 years. For more information on Troost, consult the article in the Peabody Journal of Education 30, no. 5 (March 1953) by Ellen V. Piers, called ""Gerard Troost, Pioneer Scientist"" pages 265-274.

subject.topic: French Broad River (N.C. and Tenn.) Pigeon River (N.C. and Tenn.) Newport (Tenn.) Mines and mineral resources--Tennessee--Cocke County--Maps
